identificationModule.briefTitle: Dengzhanxixin Injection for Acute Ischemic Stroke Receiving Reperfusion Therapy
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase II, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Dose-Finding, Multi-center Study to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of Dengzhanxixin Injection in Patients With Acute Ischemic Stroke Receiving Reperfusion Therapy

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To assess the Efficacy and Safety of Dengzhanxixin Injection in Patients With Acute Ischemic Stroke Receiving Reperfusion Therapy.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: To evaluate the safety and efficacy of Dengzhanxixin at different doses of 80ml/day, 40 ml/day, or placebo within 24 hours after the onset of ischemic stroke. The primary objective of this study is the proportion of subjects with excellent outcomes defined as mRS (0-1) among the three treatment groups at 90 days.

armGroups.label: Low Dose Arm
armGroups.description: Dengzhanxixin injection 40ml/day, placebo 40ml/day. Dengzhanxixin injection 40ml, diluted with 250ml of 0.9% sodium chloride injection and then slowly intravenously infused once a day; placebo injection 40ml, diluted with 250ml of 0.9% sodium chloride injection and then slowly intravenously infused once a day.

armGroups.label: High Dose Arm
armGroups.description: Dengzhanxixin injection 80ml/day. Dengzhanxixin injection 40ml, diluted with 250ml of 0.9% sodium chloride injection, and then slowly intravenously infused twice a day.

armGroups.label: Placebo Arm
armGroups.description: Placebo injection 80ml/day. Placebo injection 40ml, diluted with 250ml of 0.9% sodium chloride injection, and then slowly intravenously infused twice a day.

interventions.name: Dengzhanxixin Injection
interventions.description: Experimental arms for low, and high dose for the standard protocol

interventions.name: Placebo injection
interventions.description: placebo control arm for the standard protocol

primaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of subjects of excellent outcome defined as modified Rankin Scale (mRS) (0-1) at 90 days. mRS is a 7 grade scale from 0 to 6, where 0 is the best and 6 is the worst outcome.
Proportion of patients with adverse events at 90 days.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Infarction volume at 14 days compared to baseline

secondaryOutcomes.measure: National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) score changes from baseline. NIHSS is 42 point scale where 0 is the best o and 42 is the worst outcome.
Favourable outcome rate is defined as the proportion of subjects with modified Rankin Scale (mRS) (0-1). mRS is a 7 grade scale from 0 to 6, where 0 is the best and 6 is the worst outcome.
Ordinal distribution of Modified Rankin Scale (mRS). mRS is a 7 grade scale from 0 to 6, where 0 is the best and 6 is the worst outcome.

Proportion of subjects with Global function of daily living defined as Change in Barthel index (BI) ≥ 95. BI is a 10 item scale with scores ranging from 0 to 100, where a score of 100 is the best and 0 is the worst outcome.
Proportion of subjects with symptomatic intracranial hemorrhage (sICH)

otherOutcomes.description: The changes of serum high sensitivity C-reactive protein test (hs-CRP) level from baseline to 14 days

overallOfficials.name: Yongjun Wang, M.D.
overallOfficials.affiliation: Beijing Tiantan Hospital, Capital Medical University, Beijing, China
